00059 fsal_status_t FSAL_lookup (
00060     fsal_handle_t         * parent_directory_handle,       /* IN */
00061     fsal_name_t           * p_filename,                    /* IN */
00062     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,                     /* IN */
00063     fsal_handle_t         * object_handle,                 /* OUT */
00064     fsal_attrib_list_t    * object_attributes              /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00065 ){
00066   
00067   int rc;
00068   fsal_status_t   status;
00069   hpss_fileattr_t root_attr;
00070   
00071   ns_ObjHandle_t  obj_hdl;
00072   hpss_Attrs_t    obj_attr;
00073 
00074           
00075   /* sanity checks
00076    * note : object_attributes is optionnal
00077    *        parent_directory_handle may be null for getting FS root.
00078    */
00079   if (!object_handle || !p_context )
00080     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00081   
00082   if (!parent_directory_handle){
00083     
00084     /* check that p_filename is NULL,
00085      * else, parent_directory_handle should not
00086      * be NULL.
00087      */
00088     if ( p_filename != NULL )
00089       Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00090     
00091     /* root handle = fileset root handle */
00092     object_handle->obj_type  =
00093         hpss2fsal_type( p_context->export_context->fileset_root_handle.Type );
00094     object_handle->ns_handle = p_context->export_context->fileset_root_handle ;
00095     
00096     /* retrieves root attributes, if asked. */
00097     if (object_attributes)
00098     {      
00099       fsal_status_t status;
00100 
00101       status = FSAL_getattrs( object_handle, p_context , object_attributes );
00102 
00103       /* On error, we set a flag in the returned attributes */
00104 
00105       if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00106       {
00107         FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00108         FSAL_SET_MASK( object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00109             FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00110       }
00111     }
00112     
00113     
00114   } else {
00115     
00116     
00117     /* the filename should not be null */
00118     if ( p_filename == NULL )
00119       Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00120     
00121     
00122     /* Be careful about junction crossing, symlinks, hardlinks,... */
00123     
00124     switch ( parent_directory_handle->obj_type )
00125     {
00126       case FSAL_TYPE_DIR:
00127         /* OK */
00128         break;
00129       
00130       case FSAL_TYPE_JUNCTION:
00131          /* This is a junction */
00132          Return(ERR_FSAL_XDEV,0,INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00133         
00134       case FSAL_TYPE_FILE:
00135       case FSAL_TYPE_LNK:
00136       case FSAL_TYPE_XATTR:
00137         /* not a directory */
00138         Return(ERR_FSAL_NOTDIR,0,INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00139         
00140         
00141       default:
00142         Return(ERR_FSAL_SERVERFAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00143     }
00144                 
00145     
00146     /* call to HPSS client api */
00147     /* We use hpss_GetRawAttrHandle for not chasing junctions nor symlinks. */
00148     
00149     TakeTokenFSCall();
00150     
00151     rc = HPSSFSAL_GetRawAttrHandle( &(parent_directory_handle->ns_handle),
00152                                 p_filename->name,
00153                                 &p_context->credential.hpss_usercred,
00154                                 FALSE, /* don't traverse junctions */
00155                                 &obj_hdl,
00156                                 NULL,
00157                                 &obj_attr );
00158     
00159     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00160     
00166     if ( rc == HPSS_ENOTDIR )
00167     {
00168       if ( HPSSFSAL_IsStaleHandle( &parent_directory_handle->ns_handle,
00169                                    &p_context->credential.hpss_usercred ) )
00170       {
00171         Return( ERR_FSAL_STALE, -rc, INDEX_FSAL_lookup );
00172       }
00173     }
00174     
00175     if (rc) Return(hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00176     
00177     /* set output handle */
00178     object_handle->obj_type  = hpss2fsal_type( obj_hdl.Type );
00179     object_handle->ns_handle = obj_hdl;
00180     
00181     if ( object_attributes ) {
00182       
00183       /* convert hpss attributes to fsal attributes */
00184       
00185       
00186       status=hpss2fsal_attributes( 
00187                            &obj_hdl,
00188                            &obj_attr,
00189                            object_attributes );
00190       
00191       if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status))
00192         Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookup);
00193       
00194     }
00195     
00196   }
00197   
00198   /* lookup complete ! */
00199   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookup );
00200 
00201 }

00233 fsal_status_t FSAL_lookupJunction (
00234     fsal_handle_t         * p_junction_handle,   /* IN */
00235     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,           /* IN */
00236     fsal_handle_t         * p_fsoot_handle,      /* OUT */
00237     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_fsroot_attributes  /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00238 )
00239 {
00240   int rc;
00241   fsal_status_t   status;
00242   hpss_Attrs_t    root_attr;
00243         
00244   /* sanity checks
00245    * note : p_fsroot_attributes is optionnal
00246    */
00247   if (!p_junction_handle || !p_fsoot_handle || !p_context )
00248     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);
00249       
00250   if ( p_junction_handle->obj_type != FSAL_TYPE_JUNCTION )
00251     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);
00252       
00253   /* call to HPSS client api */
00254   /* We use hpss_GetRawAttrHandle for chasing junctions. */
00255 
00256   TakeTokenFSCall();
00257 
00258   rc = HPSSFSAL_GetRawAttrHandle( &(p_junction_handle->ns_handle),
00259                                   NULL,
00260                                   &p_context->credential.hpss_usercred,
00261                                   TRUE,     /* do traverse junctions !!! */
00262                                   NULL,
00263                                   NULL,
00264                                   &root_attr );
00265 
00266   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00267 
00268   if (rc) Return(hpss2fsal_error(rc), -rc, INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);
00269 
00270   
00271   
00272   
00273   /* set output handle */
00274   p_fsoot_handle->obj_type  = hpss2fsal_type( root_attr.FilesetHandle.Type );
00275   p_fsoot_handle->ns_handle = root_attr.FilesetHandle;
00276 
00277   if ( p_fsroot_attributes ) {
00278 
00279     /* convert hpss attributes to fsal attributes */
00280 
00281 
00282     status=hpss2fsal_attributes(
00283                          &root_attr.FilesetHandle,
00284                          &root_attr,
00285                          p_fsroot_attributes );
00286 
00287     if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status))
00288       Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction);
00289 
00290   }
00291 
00292   /* lookup complete ! */
00293   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookupJunction );
00294 }

00299 
00334 fsal_status_t FSAL_lookupPath (
00335     fsal_path_t           * p_path,            /* IN */
00336     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,         /* IN */
00337     fsal_handle_t         * object_handle,     /* OUT */
00338     fsal_attrib_list_t    * object_attributes  /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00339 ){
00340   fsal_name_t obj_name = FSAL_NAME_INITIALIZER; /* empty string */
00341   char * ptr_str;
00342   fsal_handle_t out_hdl;
00343   fsal_status_t status;
00344   int b_is_last = FALSE; /* is it the last lookup ? */
00345   
00346   /* sanity checks
00347    * note : object_attributes is optionnal.
00348    */
00349   
00350   if (!object_handle || !p_context || !p_path)
00351     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath);
00352   
00353   /* test whether the path begins with a slash*/
00354   
00355   if ( p_path->path[0] != '/' )
00356     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL,0,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath);   
00357   
00358   /* the pointer now points on the next name in the path,
00359    * skipping slashes.
00360    */
00361   
00362   ptr_str = p_path->path + 1;
00363   while (ptr_str[0] == '/') ptr_str++;
00364   
00365   /* is the next name empty ? */
00366   
00367   if (ptr_str[0] == '\0')  b_is_last = TRUE;
00368      
00369   
00370   /* retrieves root directory */
00371   
00372   status = FSAL_lookup (  NULL,     /* looking up for root */
00373                           NULL, /* empty string to get root handle */
00374                           p_context,     /* user's credentials */
00375                           &out_hdl, /* output root handle */
00376                           /* retrieves attributes if this is the last lookup :*/
00377                           ( b_is_last ? object_attributes : NULL ));
00378   
00379   if (  FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ))
00380     Return( status.major, status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );
00381   
00382   
00383   /* exits if this was the last lookup */
00384   
00385   if  ( b_is_last ){
00386     (*object_handle) = out_hdl;
00387     Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );
00388   }
00389   
00390   
00391   /* proceed a step by step lookup */
00392   
00393   while( ptr_str[0] )
00394   {
00395    
00396     fsal_handle_t  in_hdl;
00397     char * dest_ptr;
00398 
00399     /* preparing lookup */
00400     
00403     in_hdl = out_hdl;
00404 
00405     /* compute next name */
00406     obj_name.len = 0;
00407     dest_ptr = obj_name.name;
00408     while ( ptr_str[0]!='\0' && ptr_str[0]!='/')
00409     {
00410       dest_ptr[0] = ptr_str[0];
00411       dest_ptr ++ ;
00412       ptr_str  ++ ;
00413       obj_name.len ++;
00414     }
00415     /* final null char */
00416     dest_ptr[0] = '\0';
00417 
00418     /* skip multiple slashes */
00419     while (ptr_str[0] == '/') ptr_str++;
00420 
00421     /* is the next name empty ? */
00422     if (ptr_str[0] == '\0')
00423       b_is_last = TRUE;
00424     
00425     /*call to FSAL_lookup */      
00426     status = FSAL_lookup (  &in_hdl,  /* parent directory handle */
00427                             &obj_name, /* object name */
00428                             p_context,     /* user's credentials */
00429                             &out_hdl, /* output root handle */
00430                             /* retrieves attributes if this is the last lookup :*/
00431                             ( b_is_last ? object_attributes : NULL ));
00432     
00433     if (  FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00434       Return( status.major, status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );
00435 
00436     
00437     /* if the target object is a junction, an we allow cross junction lookups,
00438      * we cross it.
00439      */
00440     if ( global_fs_info.auth_exportpath_xdev && (out_hdl.obj_type == FSAL_TYPE_JUNCTION ) )
00441     {
00442       fsal_handle_t tmp_hdl;
00443       
00444       tmp_hdl = out_hdl;
00445       
00446       /*call to FSAL_lookup */
00447       status = FSAL_lookupJunction(  &tmp_hdl,  /* object handle */
00448                                      p_context, /* user's credentials */
00449                                      &out_hdl, /* output root handle */
00450                                     /* retrieves attributes if this is the last lookup :*/
00451                                     ( b_is_last ? object_attributes : NULL ));
00452 
00453     }
00454             
00455     /* ptr_str is ok, we are ready for next loop */
00456   }
00457   
00458  (*object_handle) = out_hdl;  
00459   Return( ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR, 0 ,INDEX_FSAL_lookupPath );  
00460 
00461 }
